item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 30, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Exposed DeepSeek database leaking sensitive information, including chat history (389 points | 252 comments)
2. Blueskyfeedbot: Post RSS Feeds to Bluesky via GitHub Actions (48 points | 18 comments)
3. Younger cannabis users have reduced brain function, finds largest study yet (109 points | 36 comments)
4. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (394 points | 161 comments)
5. SmolGPT: A minimal PyTorch implementation for training a small LLM from scratch (209 points | 27 comments)
6. Building a T1D smartwatch for my son from scratch (202 points | 29 comments)
7. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (435 points | 1211 comments)
8. Mathesar – an intutive spreadsheet-like interface to Postgres data (24 points | 3 comments)
9. Etleap (YC W13) Is Hiring a Senior Software Engineer (SF) ( | hide)
10. Advice for a friend who wants to start a blog (68 points | 39 comments)
11. Classic Duck Hunt Game Made in JavaScript and Kaplay (19 points | 8 comments)
12. From C++ to Clojure: Jank language promises best of both (71 points | 24 comments)
13. Parsing PDFs (and more) in Elixir using Rust (66 points | 10 comments)
14. A major Postgres upgrade with zero downtime (111 points | 39 comments)
15. Proper decoupling capacitor practices, and why you should leave 100nF behind (14 points | 4 comments)
16. Airflow – Stream media files directly from macOS to AirPlay devices (72 points | 29 comments)
17. Asteroid Impact on Earth 2032 with Probability 1% and 8Mt Energy (213 points | 189 comments)
18. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (113 points | 12 comments)
19. Soviet Shoe Factory Principle (89 points | 71 comments)
20. Keymapper: A cross-platform context-aware key remapper (43 points | 11 comments)
21. An update on Dart macros and data serialization (112 points | 94 comments)
22. The 'no. 8 wire' tradition in New Zealand (47 points | 32 comments)
23. Anthropic's CEO says DeepSeek shows US export rules are working (14 points | 1 comment)
24. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (66 points | 22 comments)
25. Cardan grille (36 points | discuss)
26. Making the video that made Gorillaz (150 points | 35 comments)
27. I still like Sublime Text (975 points | 511 comments)
28. Dead Games (119 points | 43 comments)
29. Adding iodine to salt played a role in cognitive improvements: research (2013) (194 points | 141 comments)
30. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (72 points | 20 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 30, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
